security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution capabilities. It only provides instructions for internationalization tasks and does not access files, environment variables, or make network calls.

content.user_title: Automate i18n workflows and manage translations
content.value_statement: Managing translations across multiple languages is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill streamlines i18n workflows by automatically extracting hardcoded strings and organizing translation files.
actual_capabilities: Detects i18n frameworks in your codebase
limitations: Requires manual review of extracted strings

use_cases.title: Extract strings from React components
use_cases.description: Find hardcoded text in JSX and convert to translation keys for react-i18next or similar frameworks.

use_cases.title: Audit translation coverage
use_cases.description: Compare locale files to identify missing translations and ensure complete language coverage.

use_cases.title: Implement i18n in existing apps
use_cases.description: Add internationalization support to applications with hardcoded user-facing strings.

prompt_templates.title: Extract hardcoded strings
prompt_templates.scenario: Finding untranslated text in React components
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all hardcoded strings in the src/components directory that need to be translated for i18n support.

prompt_templates.title: Create translation keys
prompt_templates.scenario: Organizing extracted strings into translation files
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert these hardcoded strings into proper translation keys for a react-i18next project.

prompt_templates.title: Check translation coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare all locale files in the translations directory and list any missing keys.

prompt_templates.title: Set up i18n framework
prompt_templates.scenario: Configuring internationalization in a new project
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up react-i18next in my Next.js app with proper configuration and folder structure.

best_practices: Use descriptive key names that indicate context, not content
Group translations by feature or module for better organization
Always provide default values when using translation functions
anti_patterns: Using source text as translation keys instead of semantic keys
Concatenating translated strings to form sentences
Hardcoding date, number, or currency formats

faq.question: Which i18n frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: React-i18next, react-intl, i18next, LinguiJS, vue-i18n, gettext, Django i18n, Flask-Babel, and Rails I18n.

faq.question: Can it translate strings automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill helps organize and structure translations but does not perform automatic translation.

faq.question: How does it handle pluralization?
faq.answer: It recognizes pluralization patterns and creates appropriate keys like items_zero, items_one, items_other for different count values.

faq.question: Will it modify my source code?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance and examples but does not automatically modify code. You maintain full control over changes.

faq.question: Can it work with existing translation files?
faq.answer: Yes, it can analyze existing locale files to check coverage and suggest improvements to key organization.

faq.question: Does it support RTL languages?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance for right-to-left languages including CSS direction properties and HTML dir attributes.
